<|endoftext|>/*
Check if in given vector of numbers, are any two numbers closer to each other than
given threshold.
>>> hasCloseElements({1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, 0.5)
false
>>> hasCloseElements({1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0}, 0.3)
true
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool hasCloseElements(vector<float> numbers, float threshold){
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    float average = sum / numbers.size();
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] - average < threshold){
            return true;
        }
    }
    return false;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Return vector of all prefixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allPrefixes("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> allPrefixes(string str){
    vector<string> prefixes;
    string prefix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i = 0; i < len; i++){
        prefix = str.substr(0, i);
        prefixes.push_back(prefix);
    }
    return prefixes;
}
/*
Return vector of all suffixes from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allSuffixes("abc")
{"bc", "c"}
*/
vector<string> allSuffixes(string str){
    vector<string> suffixes;
    string suffix;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i = len-1; i >= 0; i--){
        suffix = str.substr(i, len);
        suffixes.push_back(suffix);
    }
    return suffixes;
}

Return vector of all substrings from shortest to longest of the input string
>>> allSubstrings("abc")
{"a", "ab", "abc"}
*/
vector<string> allSubstrings(string str){
    vector<string> substrings;
    string substring;
    int len = str.length();
    for(int i = 0; i < len; i++){
        substring = str.substr(i, len);
        substrings.push_back(substring);
    }
    return substrings;
}

}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a vector of numbers, return the sum of squares of the numbers
in the vector that are odd. Ignore numbers that are negative or not integers.

doubleTheDifference({1, 3, 2, 0}) == 1 + 9 + 0 + 0 = 10
doubleTheDifference({-1, -2, 0}) == 0
doubleTheDifference({9, -2}) == 81
doubleTheDifference({0}) == 0  

If the input vector is empty, return 0.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
long long doubleTheDifference(vector<float> lst){
    long long double sum = 0;
    for(float num : lst){
        if(num > 0){
            sum += pow(num,2);
        }
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a string 'text", return its md5 hash equivalent string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> stringToMd5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string stringToMd5(string text){
    MD5_CTX md5;
    MD5_Init(&md5);
    MD5_Update(&md5, text.c_str(), text.size());
    unsigned char digest[16];
    MD5_Final(digest, &md5);
    string md5 = base64_encode(digest);
    return md5;
}

/*
Given a string 'text', return its sha256 hash equivalent string.
If 'text' is an empty string, return None.

>>> stringToSha256("Hello world") == "e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/sha.h>
using namespace std;
string stringToSha256(string text){
    SHA256_CTX sha;
    SHA256_Init(&sha);
    SHA256_Update(&sha, text.c_str(), text.size());
    unsigned char digest[32];
    SHA256_Final(digest, &sha);
    string sha256 = base64_encode(digest);
    return sha256;
}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}
